com.epoch
Class Utils

java.lang.Object
  com.epoch.Utils
All Implemented Interfaces:
FormatConstants
public final class Utils
extends Object
implements FormatConstants

Holds utility functions not chemistry-related. Includes math methods, Array-List-String interconversion methods, String manipulation methods.

toValidTextbox

public static String toValidTextbox(String s)
Convert a string so that the raw data can be displayed and edited in input textboxes and textareas. Character entity references representing foreign language characters will not be converted and will display as the foreign language characters.

Parameters:
s - a string
Returns:
textbox-compatible string

toValidTextbox

public static String toValidTextbox(String s,
                                    int convertAmps)
Convert a string so that the raw data can be displayed and edited in input textboxes and textareas.

Parameters:
s - a string
convertAmps - whether to convert ampersands; if EXCEPT_CER_NUMS (usual case), ampersands followed by # will not be converted to &amp; and, as a result, character entity references will be displayed as the characters.
Returns:
converted string

public static String toValidHTMLAttributeValue(String s)

<input type="hidden" value="<%= Utils.toValidHTMLAttributeValue(s) %>" />

Parameters:
s - a string
Returns:
attribute-compatible string

tryAppend

private static boolean tryAppend(StringBuilder out,
                                 char theChar)
Utility method for toValidTextbox(), toValidHTMLAttributeValue(), and XMLUtils.toValidXML(). Throws \n, \r, \, and & back to calling methods because they treat them differently; appends character entity references for ', ", <, and > to a growing Stringbuilder; appends other characters unchanged.

Parameters:
out - a StringBuilder
theChar - the character to be inspected
Returns:
true if we have already appended a character to the StringBuilder
